org.nd4j.tensorflow.conversion

Class TensorflowConversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nd4j.tensorflow.conversion.TensorflowConversion

  • public class TensorflowConversion
extends java.lang.Object
    Interop between nd4j INDArray and tensorflow.TF_Tensor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String defaultDeviceForThread()
      Infers the device for the given thread based on the Nd4j.getAffinityManager() Usually, this will either be a gpu or cpu reserved for the current device.
      static TensorflowConversion getInstance()
      Get a singleton instance
      org.bytedeco.javacpp.tensorflow.TF_Graph loadGraph(byte[] content)
      Get an initialized tensorflow.TF_Graph based on the passed in byte array content (the content must be a binary protobuf/pb file) The graph will be modified to be associated with the device associated with this current thread.
      org.bytedeco.javacpp.tensorflow.TF_Graph loadGraph(java.lang.String filePath)
      Get an initialized tensorflow.TF_Graph based on the passed in file (the file must be a binary protobuf/pb file) The graph will be modified to be associated with the device associated with this current thread.
      INDArray ndArrayFromTensor(org.bytedeco.javacpp.tensorflow.TF_Tensor tensor)
      Convert a INDArray to a tensorflow.TF_Tensor using zero copy.
      org.bytedeco.javacpp.tensorflow.TF_Tensor tensorFromNDArray(INDArray ndArray)
      Convert an INDArray to a tensorflow.TF_Tensor with zero copy.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static TensorflowConversion getInstance()
        Get a singleton instance
        Returns:

      • tensorFromNDArray

        public org.bytedeco.javacpp.tensorflow.TF_Tensor tensorFromNDArray(INDArray ndArray)
        Convert an INDArray to a tensorflow.TF_Tensor with zero copy. Uses a direct pointer to the underlying ndarray's data
        Parameters:
        ndArray - the ndarray to use
        Returns:
        the equivalent tensorflow.TF_Tensor

      • ndArrayFromTensor

        public INDArray ndArrayFromTensor(org.bytedeco.javacpp.tensorflow.TF_Tensor tensor)
        Convert a INDArray to a tensorflow.TF_Tensor using zero copy. It will use the underlying pointer with in nd4j.
        Parameters:
        tensor - the tensor to use
        Returns:

      • loadGraph

        public org.bytedeco.javacpp.tensorflow.TF_Graph loadGraph(java.lang.String filePath)
                                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Get an initialized tensorflow.TF_Graph based on the passed in file (the file must be a binary protobuf/pb file) The graph will be modified to be associated with the device associated with this current thread. Depending on the active Nd4j.getBackend() the device will either be the gpu pinned to the current thread or the cpu
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path to the file to read
        Returns:
        the initialized graph
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • defaultDeviceForThread

        public static java.lang.String defaultDeviceForThread()
        Infers the device for the given thread based on the Nd4j.getAffinityManager() Usually, this will either be a gpu or cpu reserved for the current device. You can think of the "current thread" as a worker. This is mainly useful with multiple gpus
        Returns:

      • loadGraph

        public org.bytedeco.javacpp.tensorflow.TF_Graph loadGraph(byte[] content)
        Get an initialized tensorflow.TF_Graph based on the passed in byte array content (the content must be a binary protobuf/pb file) The graph will be modified to be associated with the device associated with this current thread. Depending on the active Nd4j.getBackend() the device will either be the gpu pinned to the current thread or the content
        Parameters:
        content - the path to the file to read
        Returns:
        the initialized graph
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
